select1.hint: Guidance Notes: 'Correct' means that stocks should be neatly stacked on pallets so that they are accessible and are not affected by floor washing.

select1.label: C. Are dry goods laid out in an orderly fashion and in EEFO order where applicable?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Syringes have expiry dates and must therefore be organized in EEFO order. Ask which stock is going to be picked first and check whether these items have the shortest expiry date.

select1.label: D. Is the dry store clean, dry and pest-free?
E6:27a Are the records secure?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Records should be stored in lockable filing cabinets.

group.label: E7 - Distribution between each level in the supply chain is effective.

select1.label: E7:01a During the review period, did the issuing store send a distribution programme to each receiving store setting out dates for the delivery and/or collection of vaccines?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Throughout this section, the issuing store is the store which is being assessed.

input.label: E7:02a If a distribution programme exists, assess actual deliveries/collections against the programme.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Actual deliveries must be within 80% to 120% of planned deliveries. If no distribution programme exists, the score is 0.

input.label: A. Enter number of deliveries/collections (to all receiving stores) that were scheduled during the review period?
B. Record the number of deliveries/collections made during the review period.
E7:03a If a distribution programme exists, assess the timeliness of a sample of deliveries/ collections.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Sample period is context dependent. For example, if deliveries are made four times a year over two week periods, the chosen sample should be one of these two week periods.

input.label: A. How many deliveries/collections were scheduled during the sample period?
B. How many deliveries/collections actually took place during the sample period?
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Scoring: Algorithm ensures that score is always <1 if actual deliveries/ collections do not match the number scheduled.

select1.label: E7:04a If a distribution programme exists, during the review period, was there a reporting system which monitored actual vaccine distributions and compared these with planned distributions?

input.label: E7:05a Assess number of short shipments during the review period and check if they were followed up and corrected.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Compare requisition quantities with actual delivery quantities. Question the storekeeper on the actions s/he has taken to reduce the impact of short shipments when they occur.

select1.label: A. Were there any short shipments?

input.label: B. If there were short shipments, evaluate the effectiveness with which short shipments were managed and Score on a scale of 0-4].
E7:06a If cold boxes or other passive containers are used, assess knowledge of coolant preparation and packing of cold boxes, vaccine carriers and other passive containers.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Whether a systematic temperature monitoring, or journey profiling, study has been carried out. Coolant preparation includes icepack conditioning, preparation of cool water packs and preparation of coolant for palletized or wheeled passive containers.

select1.label: A. Icepack conditioning or cooling of chilled water packs is in accordance with WHO guidelines?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: For palletized or wheeled containers, follow the manufacturer's instructions.

select1.label: B. Is packing in accordance with appliance labelling or SOP?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Cold boxes, vaccine carriers and other passive containers are designed to suit a particular size of icepack. Sometimes the correct size is not available. In such circumstances it is essential that store staff know what to do.

input.label: E7:07a If refrigerated vehicles are used, assess knowledge of refrigerated vehicle packing.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Refrigerated vehicles must be packed so that temperature distribution remains even throughout the load. In addition, the load must be correctly tied down to prevent damage on bumpy roads.

select1.label: A. Is the refrigerated vehicle pre-cooled before loading?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: It is essential that refrigerated vehicles are pre-cooled before packing.

select1.label: B. Is there an SOP showing how the vehicle(s) should be packed?
C. Is packing carried out in accordance with the SOP?
E7:08a Cold climates only. Do staff know how to prevent vaccine freezing during transport?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Refer to SOP on freeze prevention for details.

select1.label: E7:09a Are freeze indicators required for the transport of freeze-sensitive vaccines?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Freeze indicators are NOT required if cool water packs are always used in passive containers and there is no risk of freezing in winter months. Freeze indicators MAY be required when vaccine is transported in refrigerated vehicles with poor temperature control or limited monitoring equipment. Freeze indicators ARE required when freeze-sensitive vaccines are packed with frozen ice packs, even if these have been conditioned. They are also recommended in very cold climates where warm water packs are needed to prevent vaccine freezing during transport.

input.label: E7:10a If freeze indicators are required, were freeze indicators packed with deliveries of freeze-sensitive vaccines during the review period? Scoring: Score on a scale of 0-4 where 4 indicates that freeze indicators were used on all deliveries and 0 indicates that they were never used.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: If freeze indicators are used, there must be an effective zero-reporting system to record the state of the freeze indicator on arrival at the receiving store.

input.label: E7:11a Select a one month sample of issue vouchers.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: If no system is in place, leave the questions unanswered. Note "absence of system" in notes box. Scoring algorithm ensures that only returned and fully completed vouchers count towards the score.

input.label: A. How many vouchers were issued by the issuing store?
B. How many arrival sections of the sampled issue vouchers have been returned to the issuing store?

select1.label: C.1 Does the returned vouchers record VVM status?

input.label: C.2 How many of the returned vouchers record VVM status ?
D. If freeze indicators are required, how many of these vouchers also record freeze indicator status?
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Scoring algorithm ensures that only returned and fully completed vouchers count towards the score.

input.label: E7:12a Assess vaccine losses caused by freezing or heat exposure during transport from the issuing store
input.hint: Guidance Notes: This is a difficult indicator to assess, unless the stock records are transparent and honest. 100% score is achieved if there are no losses. If losses occurred and damaged vaccine was replaced in a 'reasonable' time, the score is 50%.

select1.label: A. The EVM target is a total loss of less than 1%. (Score Y if this target was achieved, otherwise score N).
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Reasonable period' depends upon the level in the cold chain and the established supply interval and the extent of the vaccine damage. The country should have a clear policy to cover this and the assessment should be made against this policy.

select1.label: B. If 1% loss target was exceeded. Was the damaged vaccine replaced within a reasonable period of notification to the issuing store?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: If there is no fixed policy, use judgment. For example, at service point level, if the set supply interval is 4 weeks, then 2 weeks would be reasonable. If the supply interval is 2 weeks, then one week would be reasonable.

input.label: E7:13a Distribution contingency planning checklist.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Transport contingency plans are context-specific, but should include the following minimum elements : 1) Identify the general sources of risk (e.g. vehicle breakdown, refrigeration unit failure, lack of fuel).

select1.label: A. Is there a written transport contingency plan which describes how to deal with emergencies during distribution? Preferably there should be a plan for each distribution route.
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: 2) Identify specific risks on each route (e.g. poor roads, flooded roads, snow and ice, security risks). 3) Prepare a written plan for each route giving relevant contact details, location of emergency cold stores, sources of ice, etc.

select1.label: B. Do drivers have a radio or mobile phone to contact the supplying store and/or the receiving store during transit?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: 4) Provide each driver with a plan for the routes he covers. 5) Ensure that the information in each plan is kept up to date.

select1.label: C. Do drivers know what to do in the event of an emergency?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: 6) Ensure that all drivers know that the universal safe storage temperature for ALL vaccines in an emergency is +2°C to +8°C.

group.label: E8 - Appropriate vaccine management policies are adopted and implemented.

input.label: E8:01a Knowledge of the shake test
input.hint: Guidance Notes: This question is not applicable at health facility level in situations where there is no refrigerator

select1.label: A. Does the storekeeper or health worker know how to conduct the shake test?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check knowledge against the Shake test learning guide

select1.label: B. Does the storekeeper or health worker know when to conduct the shake test?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check knowledge against the Shake test learning guide

select1.label: C. Has the storekeeper of health worker carried out a shake test in the last 12 months?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Only score n/a if you are sure that there were no events in the review period that required a shake test.

select1.label: E8:05a Are written instructions on the use of VVMs, such as posters and stickers, available to storekeepers and health workers?
E8:06a Do storekeepers/health workers know how to read VVMs?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Use dummy VVMs and/or sticker samples to check knowledge. To score 'Y', all those responsible in the facility must answer correctly.

input.label: E8:12a Review the periodic immunization reports and/or any other reporting forms that are used to monitor vaccine wastage. [Score 0 if there is no reporting. Score on a scale of 1-4 if formal reporting exists. Use commentary to elaborate].
input.hint: Guidance Notes: At national level this question should be addressed to the EPI Manager. At lower level stores wastage rates may not be calculated. However, the information needed for the calculation should be collected and reported up the supply chain. For example, number of children immunized, doses used and doses lost, destroyed or expired.

input.label: E8:13a Wastage calculation checklist:
input.hint: Guidance Notes: At national level this question should be addressed to the EPI Manager.

select1.label: A. Do you calculate wastage rates for each vaccine?
B. Is there a standard form used to record wastage?
C. Is there a complete set of wastage records for the review period?
D. Are these data used to monitor vaccine management performance?
E8:14a Does the facility receive regular supportive supervision?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Ask staff when the last supervisory visit took place and how regular these visits are. Answer yes if the level of support is suitable, taking account of the general knowledge of the facility staff.

group.label: E9 - Information systems and supportive management functions are satisfactory.

select1.label: E9:01a Is there a Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) manual?

input.label: E9:02a Does the guidance in the SOPs follow WHO recommendations? [Score on a scale of 0-4 and elaborate in the commentary].
input.hint: Guidance Notes: A list of recommended SOPs and model examples is included in the EVM guidance documents. Assessors should check the SOPs in the country manual against this list. Some are context dependent (e.g. Using refrigerated vehicles). Scoring is a matter of judgement - consider the scope of the SOPs and their quality.

select1.label: E9:03a Is there an effective mechanism for keeping the SOP manual up-to-date?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Effective' means that there is evidence that SOPs are updated to suit changing circumstances such as new vaccine introduction. There must also be a functioning change control system.

select1.label: E9:04a Does the facility have a copy of the SOP manual?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check that relevant SOPs are available. For example there is no need to have an SOP for looking after cold rooms at lowest distribution level.

input.label: E9:05a Are training materials for storekeepers and health workers clear and correct? [Score on a scale of 0-4].
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Question for EPI manager. Where training materials exist, but there are no SOPs, assess the training materials in their own right. Training materials should cover all the key issues outlined in the EVM guidelines.

input.label: E9:06a Are these training materials consistent with WHO recommendations? [Score on a scale of 0-4 and elaborate in the commentary].
input.hint: Guidance Notes: NOTE: Question for EPI manager. Assessor guidance needed

input.label: E9:07a Checklist for vaccine needs forecasting.
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Use one of the options described in the Mid-level Management training series. Namely: 1) At primary and sub-national levels: Target population or previous consumption data. 2) At service point level: Session size. Check to ensure that there is compatibility/convergence with the method used in developing the country's comprehensive multi-year plan (cMYP).

select1.label: A. Is a standard method used to estimate annual vaccine need?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Standard method' means the UNIICEF vaccine forecasting tool or equivalent. 'Evidence-based' means that data have been systematically collected - for example national population census, updated as necessary.

select1.label: B. Is evidence-based target population data used in the calculation?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Calculations can be based on target population data and assumed vaccine wastage rates, but it is much better to use evidence-based wastage data collected from the field.

select1.label: C. Is evidence-based coverage data used in the calculation?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Coverage data will generally be taken from the routine reporting system. Ideally these data should be verified by periodic coverage surveys.

select1.label: D. Is evidence-based vaccine wastage data used in the calculation?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Calculations can be based on target population data, coverage data and assumed vaccine wastage rates, but it is much better to use evidence-based wastage data collected from the field.

select1.label: E9:08a Is an evidence-based method used to forecast need for syringes and safety boxes?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: See previous guidance note.

input.label: E9:09a Review documents where the current wastage rates have been used. [Score 0 if data are not used. Score on a scale of 0-4 if data are used. Use commentary to elaborate].
input.hint: Guidance Notes: For example: for training and supervision; for selection of vial size and session size; to inform the country's use of the multi-dose vial policy (MDVP), etc.

input.label: E9:10a Cold chain equipment inventory checklist:
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Guidance Notes: All programmes require an up-to-date cold chain equipment inventory, even if cold storage at the upper levels of the supply chain is outsourced.

select1.label: A. Is there a cold chain equipment inventory

input.label: B. If YES, how frequently is the inventory updated? [Scoring: 4 if updated once in the past year; 3 if once in the past two years; 2 if once in the past three years; 1 if once in the past four years; 0 if once in the past five years, or never updated]
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Check the inventory against a recent known sample of equipment identified at a sample of locations in the cold chain.

input.label: E9:11a Vehicle inventory checklist:
input.hint: If the programme relies on government-owned vehicles, there should be an up-to-date inventory of these. The inventory may be managed by another department, but it should exist.

select1.label: A. Is there a vehicle inventory
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: An inventory is unnecessary only if all transport is completely outsourced throughout the vaccine and commodites supply chain.

input.label: B. If YES, how frequently is the inventory updated? [Scoring: 4 if updated once in the past year; 3 if once in the past two years; 2 if once in the past three years; 1 if once in the past four years; 0 if once in the past five years, or never updated]
input.hint: Guidance Notes: Check the inventory against a recent known sample of equipment identified at a sample of locations in the cold chain.

select1.label: E9:12a Does a work plan/budget exist for the review period?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: There should be a work plan or itemised budget covering the review period.

input.label: E9:13a Considering the completed assessment of Criteria 1 to 8, did the plan cover the following topics:

select1.label: A. Cold chain equipment?
B. Vehicles?
C. Healthcare waste management?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: This question is not a substitute for a proper waste management assessment.

select1.label: D. Maintenance issues?
E. Staff resources?
F. Staff training?

input.label: E9:14a Which services are outsourced at this facility?
input.hint: The operational aspects of any contracted-out services should be assessed under criteria E1 to E8. All that these questions deal with is the adequacy of the contract conditions.

select1.label: A. Customs clearance services
B. Storage services
C. Transport services
D. Equipment maintenance services

input.label: E9:15a Customs clearance services performance checklist:

select1.label: A. Is there a written contract?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check to see if there is a written contract and that it covers the current period.

select1.label: B. Is there an enforcable penalty clause for non-compliance?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check the contract wording.

select1.label: C. Does the contract have a provision for inspection by the supervising authority?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Supervising authority could be the MoH or other ministry or agency. Check the contract wording.

select1.label: D. Is the contract supervised and monitored
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check that staff are formally allocated to this task. Check for evidence of regular supervisory visits and written reports.

select1.label: A. Is there a written contract?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check to see if there is a written contract and that it covers the current period.

select1.label: B. Is there an enforcable penalty clause for non-compliance?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check the contract wording.

select1.label: C. Does the contract have a provision for inspection by the supervising authority?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Supervising authority could be the MoH or other ministry or agency. Check the contract wording.

select1.label: D. Is the contract supervised and monitored
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check that staff are formally allocated to this task. Check for evidence of regular supervisory visits and written reports.

select1.label: A. Is there a written contract?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check to see if there is a written contract and that it covers the current period.

select1.label: B. Is there an enforcable penalty clause for non-compliance?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check the contract wording.

select1.label: C. Does the contract have a provision for inspection by the supervising authority?
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Supervising authority could be the MoH or other ministry or agency. Check the contract wording.

select1.label: D. Is the contract supervised and monitored
select1.hint: Guidance Notes: Check that staff are formally allocated to this task. Check for evidence of regular supervisory visits and written reports.
